packagegui.title: Services/FRR/Global Settings

field.description:
The name of this Access List entry.

Use 1-99 or 1300-1999 for a standard access list (source only), 100-199 or 2000-2699 for an extended access list (source and destination), or enter a text name for a zebra access list

Access List entries determine if networks are allowed or denied in specific contexts used in various routing daemons.

Order is important. Use the sequence field to reorder entries after saving. The networks may be a host, network, or "any". Exact only applies to zebra type access lists.

Leave the Destination Network blank when using a standard or zebra access list instead of an extended access list.

Only Zebra Access Lists support IPv6. The type is detected automatically based on the address given. To specify 'any' for IPv6, use 'any6'.

rowhelperfield.description: Permit or deny access to a network.
Exact match of the prefix (zebra only)
